bug.short_desc: Make fulldirhash a run-time configuration option

long_desc.thetext:
It would be much more convenient if the compile-time --enable-fulldirhash switch were made into a run-time switch in imapd.conf.
I originally filed a bug against the Debian BTS since I'm using HMH's cyrus21-imapd packages on Debian unstable.
http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=182255
I will post my original patch (which introduced a linking problem when running sieveshell), and the current patch which I'm using on my home server.

Created an attachment (id=179) First pass at run-time fulldirhash configuration option
This is the initial patch to implement a run-time configuration option for fulldirhash. It contains a bug that prevents sieveshell from working due to linking issues.

Created an attachment (id=180) Second pass at run-time fulldirhash configuration option
This patch fixes a linking bug with sieveshell by moving the dir_hash_c() function from lib/util.[ch] to imap/dir_hash.[ch], which moved the function from libcyrus.a to libimap.a. Please see the Debian BTS bug for details on why this was moved.
I patch to a non-CMU distribution isn't optimal for us. If you'd really like to see this added to Cyrus, I'd suggest making a patch against the 2.2 branch (either CVS or the 2.2.0a release).
Added this to 2.2 CVS. I didn't touch the tools/[un]dohash scripts. Do we expect a lot of upgrades from 1.6 to 2.2?
I fear for the debian stable cyrus users.
What if anything is this still waiting on?
The only missing piece is the conversion script(s). Nobody has complained yet, so maybe its not a big deal.
Punting on conversion scripts, and closing.
I'd rather this shotcoming in the upgrade path be documented. It is not serious, as long as the user upgrades to the correct fullhashdir mode first, and change it later, from what I understood...

So, what, an explanation in install-upgrade.html which says "If you are enabling this option for an existing installation, you will need to rehash your mailboxes; A script to do this is not currently provided."?
Yes, that would be good enough...

attachment.desc: First pass at run-time fulldirhash configuration option
Second pass at run-time fulldirhash configuration option
